text: do you have a scanned version of this?
Jessica, I suggest you commit it to the master. make a folder for it though, as specified by Hadi
ya for sure, I will! I was going to scan it and commit, just wanted to see what you guys thought of it first
push straight to master :simple_smile:
How do you run the tests?
npm test
Cool, thanks.
or gulp test
gulp test is better because it also takes into account your environment settings

Also, thanks to you two for getting everything set up, and for all the work you've put into it so far!
I had more trouble getting things set up than I expected, but I'll be doing much more work in the upcoming iterations... in the mean time, is there anything I need to work on now?
thanks Steve, i think everything is good to go for the marker for now. Other then that any Trello stories are available :simple_smile:
shouldnt feature/votingPage branch be deleted from repo after release?
do whatever you want with it - it is merged into both develop and master
merged master into develop
you can continue to work on it
I've gotta add a lot of functionality back end for that voting branch for the confirmation steps to work too so just chuck it wherever it fits for now
I'd suggest we keep these branches. We don't have a branch overload (yet) so we are fine with not deleting them.
There also must be a way to protect a branch from deletion using git ...
Alternatively you can keep a local copy. In that case, even if someone removes it from the remote, you can push it back up
i think you can revert if you delete a branch, but yes should keep them for now
Branch deletion is destructive. GitHub has branch protection in the repo settings, I think that only the repo owner can turn it on.
I'll do that then
There shouldn't be anything not committed inside that branch so it's not a huge deal we can just create another branch on i2 no?
If it's merged somewhere else you won't lose anything by deleting it.
which branch are we talking about? the one that that was merged into master?
Yeah I think it was merged already anyways
I believe do lose information about the merge history when you delete, but that's not likely important to us.
